title: 16-Element Stack Function Block
description: This function block implements a stack data structure with a fixed capacity of 16 elements. It supports reading from and writing to the stack, along with reset functionality. The stack operates in a first-in-last-out (FILO) manner, and the block provides status indicators for the emptiness and fullness of the stack.
name: STACK_16

input.name: Din
input.description: The data input to be written to the stack.

input.name: E
input.description: Enable input, which must be TRUE for read or write operations to occur. Defaults to TRUE.

input.name: RD
input.description: Read signal, which when TRUE and stack is not empty, triggers the reading of the top element from the stack.

input.name: WD
input.description: Write signal, which when TRUE and stack is not full, triggers the writing of the input data to the stack.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset signal, when TRUE resets the stack to its initial state.

output.name: Dout
output.description: The data output that provides the most recently read value from the stack.

output.name: EMPTY
output.description: Indicates if the stack is empty. TRUE if the stack is empty.

output.name: FULL
output.description: Indicates if the stack is full. TRUE if the stack is full.
